intro: Rinorea endotricha, commonly known as the velvet leaf or velvet plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. It typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Rinorea endotricha produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
